climbs.name: White Men Don't Jump (Jump Start Right)

content.description: Right jump start problem. Move left once you gain start hold. Move up slab.

#41 on the Marty Map (go buy it!). This problem is listed with zero stars on the map but I think it’s the best V0 in the canyon. Sit start with hand jams and jam your way up with huge jugs to chill and take a puff of your Backwoods. You can also practice OW jams (totally unnecessary) if you’re interested in loosing some skin.
content.protection: A boomer with some thrash metal to keep you psyched.
content.location: Just south of the Amphitheater / Elephant Tree. Look for the tall overhung crack.

content.description: Sit down start.  Obvious roof crack to the north of the Ampitheater.  Follow the crack on sinker hands over the lip to jugs.  Short problem but fun jams.
content.protection: Spotter and a pad.  A fall might lead to sliding a ways down.  Definitely one of those problems that a spotter is warrented.
content.location: About 30 yards north of the middle of the Amphitheater.  Go up the easy boulders towards the obvious roof splitter.  Can be seen from the base of Sharks Tooth if looking North.

content.description: Start at bottom of slab. End at top. Climb down.
content.protection: Pad and spotter. It should be noted that this problem is the "walkoff" for other problems on this boulder. For beginner boulders make sure you're willing to come down the same slab before you get up there!
content.location: This is the low angle slab on the right side of the amphitheater. If you are facing the "jump start" problems, it is the slab just to the right on the big boulder.

content.description: #28 on the Marty Map (go buy it!). Start on the arete and climb up and left on slopey holds to the top.
content.location: On the north side of the Cocaine Corner boulder

content.description: Sit down start in the same cave as Nutshell.  Follow the crack/rail up and left to a jug.  Then stem out face and top out above Elephant Tree.
content.location: Located in the cave just to the right of Elephant Tree.  Same start as Nutshell.

content.description: Sit start in cave to left of elephant tree. Climb around/under the nut shell and top out on face.
content.location: Back left corner of the amphitheater. At the right end of the very long, low, featureless overhang. It looks like a nutshell and is just right of elephant tree.

content.description: The problem is essentially the easy parts of Elephant Tree (V6) starting at the big flake jug. Work your hands up the diagonal and reach for a couple good but small holds before topping out.
content.location: South side of The Amphitheater, easy to spot jug start.

content.description: Climb crack above and North of the jump start problems.
content.location: North and above the jump start problems. Can be seen from Sharks Tooth.

content.description: Jump start to good crimps, throw a heel out left, bump right to flake, rock up over bulge and work slab to top.
content.location: Large overhanging bulge behind T-rex boulder

content.description: Start in back of cave by nut shell. Climb out left on sharp rail to under cling and up to horn. Top out.
content.location: Back left corner of the amphitheater. At the right end of the very long, low, featureless overhangs.

content.description: Starts on obvious good hold. Goes right and up. It is a one move wonder. The top out is V-easy once you do the trick move off of the start hold. You will curse and cry and wonder why you can't do it till you figure out the proper feet. Once you get to the top you will probably never do it again...
content.protection: Pad and spotter. There is a tree and a rock you don't want to hit if I recall correctly..
content.location: This is the large boulder on the right side of the amphitheater. If you are facing the "jump start" problems, it is the big boulder on the right. Sharks Tooth and Cocaine Corner are on the same boulder. MVFBis on the side opposite of the jump start problems.

content.description: This is the arete that is on the right hand side of Sharks tooth. It is the obvious arete that is facing into the amphitheater.
content.protection: Pads and spotters. Bad fall. Don't fall...
content.location: his is the large boulder on the right side of the amphitheater. If you are facing the "jump start" problems, it is the big boulder on the right. Sharks Tooth and MVFB are on the same boulder. Cocaine Corner is on the side facing into the amphitheater

content.description: Up the wash trail past the warm up wall. Obvious flat, enclosed granite amphitheater area atop steep segment of the wash.
